About

Hello, Tech World

I'm Solomon Zelenko and programming is my craft.

While studying neuroscience, I supported my education by teaching young children applied math, coding, and creative problem solving. OpenWorld Learning was an after-school program that brought those skills to disadvantaged children in the Denver Area.

As my students matured and overcame challenges, they inspired me. From 2015 to 2018, I discovered that I enjoyed programming - whether the code ran or not. So I took a chance on myself and revised my career path.

Ultimately, this decision has culminated in 2 years of self, group, and mentored study; 3 portfolio projects; and a new perspective. Bottom line, I write clean code, have the mindset to identify and solve problems, and enjoy the challenges.

When it's time to take a break, you can find me practicing voiceover acting, staying active, and writing.
